segment.source: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Manage Connection Groups on a Stand-alone Computer by Using PowerShell

segment.source: An App-V connection group allows you to run all the virtual applications as a defined set of packages in a single virtual environment.
segment.target: An App-V connection group allows you to run all the virtual applications as a defined set of packages in a single virtual environment.

segment.source: For example, you can virtualize an application and its plug-ins by using separate packages, but run them together in a single connection group.
segment.target: For example, you can virtualize an application and its plug-ins by using separate packages, but run them together in a single connection group.

segment.source: A connection group XML file defines the connection group that runs on the computer where you’ve installed the App-V client.
segment.target: A connection group XML file defines the connection group that runs on the computer where you’ve installed the App-V client.

segment.source: For information about the connection group XML file and how to configure it, see About the Connection Group File.
segment.target: For information about the connection group XML file and how to configure it, see About the Connection Group File.

segment.source: This topic explains the following procedures:
segment.target: This topic explains the following procedures:

segment.source: To add and publish the App-V packages in the connection group
segment.target: To add and publish the App-V packages in the connection group

segment.source: To add and enable the connection group on the App-V client
segment.target: To add and enable the connection group on the App-V client

segment.source: To enable or disable a connection group for a specific user
segment.target: To enable or disable a connection group for a specific user

segment.source: To allow only administrators to enable connection groups
segment.target: To allow only administrators to enable connection groups

segment.source: To add and publish the App-V packages in the connection group
segment.target: To add and publish the App-V packages in the connection group

segment.source: To add and publish the App-V 5.0 packages to the computer running the App-V client, type the following command:
segment.target: To add and publish the App-V 5.0 packages to the computer running the App-V client, type the following command:

segment.source: Add-AppvClientPackage –path c:tmpstorequartfin.appv | Publish-AppvClientPackage
segment.target: Add-AppvClientPackage –path c:tmpstorequartfin.appv | Publish-AppvClientPackage

segment.source: Repeat step 1 of this procedure for each package in the connection group.
segment.target: Repeat step 1 of this procedure for each package in the connection group.

segment.source: To add and enable the connection group on the App-V client
segment.target: To add and enable the connection group on the App-V client

segment.source: Add the connection group by typing the following command:
segment.target: Add the connection group by typing the following command:

segment.source: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup –path c:tmpstorefinanc.xml
segment.target: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup –path c:tmpstorefinanc.xml

segment.source: Enable the connection group by typing the following command:
segment.target: Enable the connection group by typing the following command:

segment.source: Enable-AppvClientConnectionGroup –name “Financial Applications”
segment.target: Enable-AppvClientConnectionGroup –name “Financial Applications”

segment.source: When any virtual applications that are in the member packages are run on the target computer, they will run inside the connection group’s virtual environment and will be available to all the virtual applications in the other packages in the connection group.
segment.target: When any virtual applications that are in the member packages are run on the target computer, they will run inside the connection group’s virtual environment and will be available to all the virtual applications in the other packages in the connection group.

segment.source: To enable or disable a connection group for a specific user
segment.target: To enable or disable a connection group for a specific user

segment.source: Review the parameter description and requirements:
segment.target: Review the parameter description and requirements:

segment.source: The parameter enables an administrator to enable or disable a connection group for a specific user.
segment.target: The parameter enables an administrator to enable or disable a connection group for a specific user.

segment.source: You must use App-V 5.0 SP2 Hotfix Package 5 or later to use this parameter.
segment.target: You must use App-V 5.0 SP2 Hotfix Package 5 or later to use this parameter.

segment.source: You can run this cmdlet from the user or administrator session.
segment.target: You can run this cmdlet from the user or administrator session.

segment.source: You must be logged in with administrative credentials to use the parameter.
segment.target: You must be logged in with administrative credentials to use the parameter.

segment.source: The end user must be logged in.
segment.target: The end user must be logged in.

segment.source: You must provide the end user’s security identifier (SID).
segment.target: You must provide the end user’s security identifier (SID).

segment.source: Use the following cmdlets, and add the optional –UserSID parameter, where -UserSID represents the end user’s security identifier (SID):
segment.target: Use the following cmdlets, and add the optional –UserSID parameter, where -UserSID represents the end user’s security identifier (SID):

segment.source: Cmdlet
segment.target: Cmdlet

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: Enable-AppVClientConnectionGroup
segment.target: Enable-AppVClientConnectionGroup

segment.source: Enable-AppVClientConnectionGroup “ConnectionGroupA” -UserSID S-1-2-34-56789012-3456789012-345678901-2345
segment.target: Enable-AppVClientConnectionGroup “ConnectionGroupA” -UserSID S-1-2-34-56789012-3456789012-345678901-2345

segment.source: Disable -AppVClientConnectionGroup
segment.target: Disable -AppVClientConnectionGroup

segment.source: Disable -AppVClientConnectionGroup “ConnectionGroupA” -UserSID S-1-2-34-56789012-3456789012-345678901-2345
segment.target: Disable -AppVClientConnectionGroup “ConnectionGroupA” -UserSID S-1-2-34-56789012-3456789012-345678901-2345

segment.source: To allow only administrators to enable connection groups
segment.target: To allow only administrators to enable connection groups

segment.source: Review the description and requirement for using this cmdlet:
segment.target: Review the description and requirement for using this cmdlet:

segment.source: Use this cmdlet and parameter to configure the App-V client to allow only administrators (not end users) to enable or disable connection groups.
segment.target: Use this cmdlet and parameter to configure the App-V client to allow only administrators (not end users) to enable or disable connection groups.

segment.source: You must be using at least App-V 5.0 SP3 to use this cmdlet.
segment.target: You must be using at least App-V 5.0 SP3 to use this cmdlet.

segment.source: Run the following cmdlet and parameter:
segment.target: Run the following cmdlet and parameter:

segment.source: Cmdlet
segment.target: Cmdlet

segment.source: Parameter and values
segment.target: Parameter and values

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: Set-AppvClientConfiguration
segment.target: Set-AppvClientConfiguration

segment.source: –RequirePublishAsAdmin
segment.target: –RequirePublishAsAdmin

segment.source: 0 - False
segment.target: 0 - False

segment.source: 1 - True
segment.target: 1 - True

segment.source: Set-AppvClientConfiguration –RequirePublishAsAdmin1
segment.target: Set-AppvClientConfiguration –RequirePublishAsAdmin1
